AVSEC Order  No. 02/2011 
Subject:- 
Deployment of  suitably trained  personnel  to deal with  case of  
unlawful interference. 
In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 1934, 
delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification No. 
1797, dated July 3, 1997, Commissioner of Security (Civil Aviation), Bureau of Civil 
Aviation Security for the purpose of securing the aircraft   operations  directs that : 
(i) 
authorized and suitably trained and  equipped armed personnel of CISF, NSG  
and concerned State/ UT Police, as  the case  may be, shall be  readily available 
for deployment at the airports in India serving civil aviation to assist in dealing 
with suspected or actual cases of unlawful interference with civil aviation; and  
(ii) 
all  those personnel involved  in the implementation of  preventive  security 
measures  as well as  to deal with suspected and  actual cases of unlawful 
interference, understand aviation security  principles,  are  knowledgeable  of 
the procedures  to be followed  and  the  chain of command and   
communication in an emergency  situation. 
 
 
 
(Gurjot Singh Malhi, IPS) 
Commissioner of  Security  (CA )
